Package view.gui

Class GUIStockView

  • java.lang.Object
    • view.gui.GUIStockView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, AdvancedStockView, StockView
    public class GUIStockView
extends java.lang.Object
implements AdvancedStockView, java.awt.event.ActionListener
    The GUIStockView class represents a GUI view for the stock program, made using Java Swing. This GUIStockView class takes in a DelayedInputStream object, which is used to communicate with the GUIController class, through appending commands that are formatted and added to the input stream, using the CommandUtils class. This view is designed to be used with the GUIController class, and provides the user with the ability to interact with the stock data through a GUI interface.

      • failedOperation

        public void failedOperation​(java.lang.String operationName,
                            java.lang.String relevantInfo)
        pop up for a failed operation. THIS SHOULD NEVER HAPPEN IN A WORKING DEPLOYED PROGRAM. If this does get called we show a fatal error because it means the view button inputs are messed up.
        Specified by:
        failedOperation in interface StockView
        Parameters:

        public void displayBuy​(java.lang.String ticker,
                       int amt,
                       double totalOwned)
        Displays pop up for buying stock, used when a stock is auto bought at a date/ PLEASE NOTE FOR REVIEW: this functionality is not currently supported through the options in displayMenu(boolean). We only have the option to buy a stock at a given date.
        Specified by:
        displayBuy in interface StockView
        Parameters:
        ticker - the ticker of the stock that was bought.
        amt - the amount of the stock that was bought.
        totalOwned - the total value of that stock now owned (including previously owned stock).
